TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NetworkChange extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Allows applications to receive notification when the Internet Protocol (IP) address of a network interface, also called a network card or adapter, changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange> class provides address change notification by raising <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged> events. An interface address can change for many reasons, such as a disconnected network cable, moving out of range of a wireless Local Area Network, or hardware failure.
To receive notification, you must identify your application's event handlers, which are one or more methods that perform your application-specific tasks each time the event is raised. To have a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange> object call your event-handling methods when a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged> event occurs, you must associate the methods with a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkAddressChangedEventHandler> delegate, and add this delegate to the event.
## Examples The following code example listens for address changes and displays the status of network interfaces when a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged> event occurs.
[!code-cpp[NclNetAddressChanged1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclNetAddressChanged1/CPP/changed.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NclNetAddressChanged1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclNetAddressChanged1/CS/changed.cs#1)] [!code-vb[NclNetAddressChanged1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclNetAddressChanged1/VB/changed.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Custom Event NetworkAddressChanged As NetworkAddressChangedEventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when the IP address of a network interface changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange> class raises <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged> events when the address of a network interface, also called a network card or adapter, changes.
To have a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange> object call an event-handling method when a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged> event occurs, you must associate the method with a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkAddressChangedEventHandler> delegate, and add this delegate to this event.
The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged> event is supported on Windows 2000 and later.
## Examples The following code example listens for address changes and displays the status of network interfaces when a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAddressChanged> event occurs.
[!code-cpp[NclNetAddressChanged1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclNetAddressChanged1/CPP/changed.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NclNetAddressChanged1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclNetAddressChanged1/CS/changed.cs#1)] [!code-vb[NclNetAddressChanged1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NclNetAddressChanged1/VB/changed.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Custom Event NetworkAvailabilityChanged As NetworkAvailabilityChangedEventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when the availability of the network changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange> class raises <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAvailabilityChanged> events when the availability of the network changes. The network is available when at least one network interface is marked "up" and is not a tunnel or loopback interface.
To have a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange> object call an event-handling method when a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAvailabilityChanged> event occurs, you must associate the method with a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkAvailabilityChangedEventHandler> delegate, and add this delegate to this event.
The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkChange.NetworkAvailabilityChanged> event is supported on Windows 2000 and later.
